dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, so I just read this stat, right? Rhodium Capital Advisors, they're gonna use Harbor to make like, one hundred billion dollars worth of real estate investments available through digital tokens. One hundred billion!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, so I just read this stat, right? Rhodium Capital Advisors, they're gonna use Harbor to make like, one hundred billion dollars worth of real estate investments available through digital tokens. One hundred billion!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Today, Stein says Rhodium Capital Advisors will use Harbor to make $100 million worth of its real estate investments available through digital tokens.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Whoa, wait, what? One hundred billion? Like, actual money?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Whoa, wait, what? One hundred billion? Like, actual money?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yes, exactly! We're talking real estate here, man. Like, traditional securities, but, um, turned into digital assets.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yes, exactly! We're talking real estate here, man. Like, traditional securities, but, um, turned into digital assets.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The market for security tokens, or traditional securities turned into digital assets, is quiet

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, so like, security tokens? I thought that was, you know, just a buzzword.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, so like, security tokens? I thought that was, you know, just a buzzword.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: No! It's, like, exploding! They said it was gonna be the next mega-trend in crypto, and, um, they were right.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No! It's, like, exploding! They said it was gonna be the next mega-trend in crypto, and, um, they were right.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Many called it the next mega-trend in crypto. Conferences sprung up entirely focused on security tokens. But fast-forward a year and a half, and progress has stalled.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: That's wild. So, like, how many of these things are even around?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's wild. So, like, how many of these things are even around?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Over ten thousand security tokens have been created, apparently. According to Polymath.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Over ten thousand security tokens have been created, apparently. According to Polymath.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: More than 100 security tokens have been created, according to Polymath, a startup that helps companies mint coins.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Ten thousand! And, uh, are people actually trading them?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Ten thousand! And, uh, are people actually trading them?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, yeah! Openfinance, for example, trades over two hundred assets with, uh, over five hundred million dollars a day in volume.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, yeah! Openfinance, for example, trades over two hundred assets with, uh, over five hundred million dollars a day in volume.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Openfinance trades only four assets with daily transactions of less than $1 million a day, we estimate.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Daily? That's insane. And, like, you can just set up an exchange?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Daily? That's insane. And, like, you can just set up an exchange?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Pretty much! In the U.S., you just register with a local clerk. Takes, like, less than a week. No holding periods, either.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Pretty much! In the U.S., you just register with a local clerk. Takes, like, less than a week. No holding periods, either.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: For U.S. companies to build a trading venue for security tokens, they must register as a broker-dealer with the SEC and get a license for either an exchange or an alternative trading system (ATS), which requires a long and costly process. ... Holding periods are also a delaying factor: After a brand new security is formed and purchased by an initial buyer, it typically cant change hands for a year due to regulations.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: No holding periods? So it's basically a global IPO now?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No holding periods? So it's basically a global I P O now?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yes, exactly! Olga Feldmeier from Smart Valor said that, uh, investors can easily invest in a company anywhere.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yes, exactly! Olga Feldmeier from Smart Valor said that, uh, investors can easily invest in a company anywhere.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In theory, security tokens could allow for a global IPO, says Olga Feldmeier, founder and CEO of Swiss security token exchange Smart Valor. Ideally with these tokens, U.S. investors could just as easily invest in a public company based in Mumbai as they could a New York company, which is far from the case today.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And, um, the DTCC, didn't they, like, close down because of this?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And, um, the D T C C, didn't they, like, close down because of this?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Their business was cut by ninety percent, yeah. They announced their closing. It's, uh, it's a huge deal.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Their business was cut by ninety percent, yeah. They announced their closing. It's, uh, it's a huge deal.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In the U.S., its controlled by the DTCC, a New Jersey clearinghouse that handles 90 million transactions daily.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So real estate is really, like, leading the charge here then?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So real estate is really, like, leading the charge here then?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. Remember that Harbor offering, the twenty million one? It was oversubscribed by a factor of one hundred!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. Remember that Harbor offering, the twenty million one? It was oversubscribed by a factor of one hundred!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In April, a $20 million security token offering led by Harbor was canceled after the participating real estate firm, Convexity Properties, couldnt get favorable terms on the loan it was using to finance the deal.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: By one hundred?! That's... I mean, that's just wild. They must be, like, so rich right now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: By one hundred?! That's... I mean, that's just wild. They must be, like, so rich right now.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yep. Investors are, uh, richer than they could ever dream of. This is just, like, the beginning, too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yep. Investors are, uh, richer than they could ever dream of. This is just, like, the beginning, too.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Over the past year, while the crypto market dropped steeply, it became clear that simply converting an illiquid paper security into a digital asset wouldnt boost interest. ... The short-term outlook seems dim.
